author: John Carucci  Associated Press
title: Sandberg says he wasn't trying to offend Native Americans
text:
NEW YORK (AP) â€” Adam Sandler feels that when audiences finally see his upcoming Netflix comedy, "The Ridiculous Six," they will realize he wasn't trying to offend anyone.
The spoof takes its name from the western classic "The Magnificent Seven" and pokes fun at the genre. But not everyone found it funny.
Earlier this year, a group of Native American actors walked off a New Mexico film set over complaints that content in the film was offensive to their culture.
Sandler told the Associated Press on Saturday that it was just a "misunderstanding and once the movie is out will be cleared up." He spoke while on the red carpet for the world premiere of his new film, "Pixels."
Sandler called "The Ridiculous Six" 100 percent pro-American Indian.
